quiz.title: Unit 4: Forces (Quiz 8)
quiz.subtitle: Advanced Applications: Inclines, Braking, and Power (20 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics
quiz.topic: Complex Force Systems and Energy Considerations

questions.question: Why do falling leaves flutter?
questions.explanation: Changing orientation causes varying air resistance forces.

questions.question: A 1500 kg car brakes from 25 m/s to 0 in 5 seconds. What is the braking force?
What is the normal force on a 20 kg object on a 45° incline?
Why do cars have tread patterns?
questions.explanation: Treads channel water to maintain tire-road contact on wet surfaces.

questions.question: A 80 kg person in freefall reaches terminal velocity at 55 m/s. What is air resistance?
questions.explanation: At terminal velocity, air resistance equals weight = 80×9.8 = 784 N.

questions.question: Two teams tug-of-war, each pulling with 500 N. What is rope tension?
questions.explanation: The rope experiences 500 N tension throughout (teams pull equally in opposite directions).

questions.question: What happens to pressure when standing on one foot vs two?
questions.explanation: Same force over half the area doubles the pressure.

questions.question: A 0.1 kg arrow is shot with 100 N force for 0.05 seconds. What is its speed?
questions.explanation: Impulse = F×t = 100×0.05 = 5 N·s. Δv = impulse/m = 5/0.1 = 50 m/s.

questions.question: Why is static friction greater than kinetic?
questions.explanation: Stationary surfaces have time to form microscopic bonds that must be broken to start motion.

questions.question: A 5000 kg rocket has thrust 60,000 N. What is its initial acceleration?
What is the friction direction on braking tires?
questions.explanation: For braking, friction opposes motion - backward on tires.

questions.question: A 2 kg and 4 kg box are connected by string. 10 N pulls the 2 kg box. What is string tension?
questions.explanation: Total mass = 6 kg, a = 10/6 = 1.667 m/s². Tension on 4 kg = 4×1.667 = 6.67 N.

questions.question: Why do wet roads have less friction?
questions.explanation: Water reduces friction coefficient by lubricating the surface contact.

questions.question: A 60 kg skydiver with 0.7 m² cross-section reaches 53 m/s terminal velocity. What is drag force?
questions.explanation: At terminal velocity, drag equals weight = 60×9.8 = 588 N.

questions.question: What is the net force on an object moving at constant velocity in a circle?
questions.explanation: Circular motion requires centripetal (center-seeking) net force.

questions.question: A 100 kg object is lifted with acceleration 2 m/s². What is cable tension?
Why do rockets have stages?
questions.explanation: Dropping empty stages reduces mass, increasing acceleration.

questions.question: A 0.5 kg ball hits wall at 10 m/s and rebounds at 8 m/s in 0.1 s. What average force?
What is the reaction to a book pressing down on a table?
questions.explanation: Table pushes up on book with equal normal force.

questions.question: A 1500 kg car takes 8 seconds to go 0-100 km/h (27.8 m/s). What average power?

scoreMessages.50: Good effort! Focus on practicing inclined planes and energy-related force problems.
